VRCameraController.name: VRCameraController
VRCameraController.description: This component allow to integrate with WebVR to use VR Headset

Rotator.name: Rotator
Rotator.description: Rotator rotate a mesh over time

LS.Components.Camera.name: LS.Components.Camera
LS.Components.Camera.description: Camera that contains the info about a camera

LS.Components.CameraFX.name: LS.Components.CameraFX
LS.Components.CameraFX.description: This component allow to create basic FX

LS.Components.CustomData.name: LS.Components.CustomData
LS.Components.CustomData.description: This module allows to store custom data inside a node

LS.Components.GraphComponent.name: LS.Components.GraphComponent
LS.Components.GraphComponent.description: This component allow to integrate a behaviour graph on any object

LS.Components.FXGraphComponent.name: LS.Components.FXGraphComponent
LS.Components.FXGraphComponent.description: This component allow to integrate a rendering post FX using a graph

LS.Components.Knob.name: LS.Components.Knob
LS.Components.Knob.description: Knob allows to rotate a mesh like a knob (rotate when dragging)

LS.Components.Light.name: LS.Components.Light
LS.Components.Light.description: Light that contains the info about the camera

LS.Components.LightFX.name: LS.Components.LightFX
LS.Components.LightFX.description: LightFX create volumetric and flare effects to the light

LS.Components.NodeManipulator.name: LS.Components.NodeManipulator
LS.Components.NodeManipulator.description: Node manipulator, allows to rotate it

LS.Components.PlayAnimation.name: LS.Components.PlayAnimation
LS.Components.PlayAnimation.description: Reads animation tracks from an Animation resource and applies the properties to the objects referenced

LS.Components.Script.name: LS.Components.Script
LS.Components.Script.description:
Script must be coded in Javascript and they have full access to all the engine, so one script could replace the behaviour of any part of the engine.
Scripts are executed inside their own context, the context is local to the script so any variable defined in the context that is not attached to the context wont be accessible from other parts of the engine.
To interact with the engine Scripts must bind callback to events so the callbacks will be called when those events are triggered, however, there are some generic methods that will be called

LS.Components.Spherize.name: LS.Components.Spherize
LS.Components.Spherize.description: Spherize deforms a mesh, it is an example of a deformer, a component that modifies the meshes of one node

LS.Components.Target.name: LS.Components.Target
LS.Components.Target.description: Target rotate a mesh to look at the camera or another object

LS.Animation.name: LS.Animation
LS.Animation.description:
An Animation is a resource that contains samples of properties over time, similar to animation curves
Values could be associated to an specific node.
Data is contained in tracks

LS.Animation.Track.name: LS.Animation.Track
LS.Animation.Track.description:
Represents one track with data over time about one property
Data could be stored in two forms, or an array containing arrays of [time,data] or in a single typed array, depends on the attribute typed_mode

LS.Prefab.name: LS.Prefab
LS.Prefab.description:
Prefab work in two ways: 
- It can contain a node structure and all the associated resources (textures, meshes, animations, etc)
- When a node in the scene was created from a Prefab, the prefab is loaded so the associated resources are recovered, but the node structure is not modified.

LS.TextureFX.name: LS.TextureFX
LS.TextureFX.description:
helps apply basic effects to a texture with as fewer render calls as possible with low memory footprint
used by CameraFX but also available for any other use

LS.Material.name: LS.Material
LS.Material.description:
Material class contains all the info about how a mesh should be rendered, more in a highlevel format.
Most of the info is Colors, factors and Textures but it can also specify a shader or some flags.
Materials could be shared among different objects.

LS.StandardMaterial.name: LS.StandardMaterial
LS.StandardMaterial.description: StandardMaterial class improves the material class

LS.RenderInstance.name: LS.RenderInstance
LS.RenderInstance.description: RenderInstance contains info of one object to be rendered on the scene.

LS.RenderSettings.name: LS.RenderSettings
LS.RenderSettings.description: There could be different renderSettings for different scene quality.

LS.Renderer.name: LS.Renderer
LS.Renderer.description: The Renderer is in charge of generating one frame of the scene. Contains all the passes and intermediate functions to create the frame.

LS.Draw.name: LS.Draw
LS.Draw.description:
LS.Draw allows to render basic primitives, similar to the OpenGL Fixed pipeline.
It reuses local meshes when possible to avoid fragmenting the VRAM.

LS.LScript.name: LS.LScript
LS.LScript.description: LScript allows to compile code during execution time having a clean context

LS.WBin.name: LS.WBin
LS.WBin.description: WBin allows to create binary files easily (similar to WAD format). You can pack lots of resources in one file or extract them.

LS.Component.name: LS.Component
LS.Component.description:
This is an example class for a component, should never be instantiated by itself, 
instead components get all the methods from this class attached when the component is registered.
Components can overwrite this methods if they want.

LS.ComponentContainer.name: LS.ComponentContainer
LS.ComponentContainer.description: ComponentContainer class allows to add component based properties to any other class

LS.CompositePattern.name: LS.CompositePattern
LS.CompositePattern.description:
CompositePattern implements the Composite Pattern, which allows to one class to contain instances of its own class
creating a tree-like structure.

LS.LS.name: LS.LS
LS.LS.description: Samples a curve and returns the resulting value

params.name: x
params.description: the position in the curve to sample

LS.LSQ.name: LS.LSQ
LS.LSQ.description: LSQ allows to set or get values easily from the global scene, using short strings as identifiers

LS.Formats.name: LS.Formats
LS.Formats.description: Formats is the class where all the info about what is every format, how to parse it, etc, is located

params.name: id
params.description: the id (otherwise a random one is computed)

LS.Collision.name: LS.Collision
LS.Collision.description:
Contains information about the collision of a ray and the scene
- position: vec3
- node: SceneNode
- instance: could be a RenderInstance or a PhysicsInstance
- distance: number

LS.PhysicsInstance.name: LS.PhysicsInstance
LS.PhysicsInstance.description: PhysicsInstance contains info of a colliding object. Used to test collisions with the scene

LS.Physics.name: LS.Physics
LS.Physics.description: Physics is in charge of all physics testing methods

LS.Picking.name: LS.Picking
LS.Picking.description: Picking is used to detect which element is below one pixel (used the GPU) or using raycast

LS.Player.name: LS.Player
LS.Player.description:
Player class allows to handle the app context easily without having to glue manually all events
	There is a list of options
	==========================
	- canvas: the canvas where the scene should be rendered, if not specified one will be created
	- container_id: string with container id where to create the canvas, width and height will be those from the container
	- width: the width for the canvas in case it is created without a container_id
	- height: the height for the canvas in case it is created without a container_id
	- resources: string with the path to the resources folder
	- shaders: string with the url to the shaders.xml file
	- proxy: string with the url where the proxy is located (useful to avoid CORS)
	- filesystems: object that contains the virtual file systems info { "VFS":"http://litefileserver.com/" } ...
	- redraw: boolean to force to render the scene constantly (useful for animated scenes)
	- autoresize: boolean to automatically resize the canvas when the window is resized
	- autoplay: boolean to automatically start playing the scene once the load is completed
	- loadingbar: boolean to show a loading bar
	Optional callbacks to attach
	============================
	- onPreDraw: executed before drawing a frame
	- onDraw: executed after drawing a frame
	- onPreUpdate(dt): executed before updating the scene (delta_time as parameter)
	- onUpdate(dt): executed after updating the scene (delta_time as parameter)
	- onMouse(e): when a mouse event is triggered
	- onKey(e): when a key event is triggered

params.name: options
params.description: settings for the webgl context creation

LS.Project.name: LS.Project
LS.Project.description:
The Project is the top-most object that contains the whole application, from the project we can load other scenes
Still a work in progress

LS.ResourcesManager.name: LS.ResourcesManager
LS.ResourcesManager.description:
Static class that contains all the resources loaded, parsed and ready to use.
It also contains the parsers and methods in charge of processing them

LS.SceneTree.name: LS.SceneTree
LS.SceneTree.description: The SceneTree contains all the info about the Scene and nodes

LS.SceneNode.name: LS.SceneNode
LS.SceneNode.description:
The SceneNode class represents and object in the scene
Is the base class for all objects in the scene as meshes, lights, cameras, and so

params.name: id
params.description: the id (otherwise a random one is computed)

LS.ShadersManager.name: LS.ShadersManager
LS.ShadersManager.description: ShadersManager is the static class in charge of loading, compiling and storing shaders for reuse.

LS.ShaderQuery.name: LS.ShaderQuery
LS.ShaderQuery.description: ShadersManager is the static class in charge of loading, compiling and storing shaders for reuse.

params.description: for a list of supported channels by this material call getTextureChannels()

params.name: value
params.description: the value, for uvs check Material.TEXTURE_COORDINATES, filter is gl.NEAREST or gl.LINEAR and wrap gl.CLAMP_TO_EDGE, gl.MIRROR or gl.REPEAT

classitems.description: Returns the texture in a channel
classitems.name: getTexture

classitems.description: Returns the texture sampler info of one texture channel (filter, wrap, uvs)
classitems.name: getTextureSampler

classitems.description: Assigns a texture sampler to one texture channel (filter, wrap, uvs)
classitems.name: setTextureInfo

classitems.description: Collects all the resources needed by this material (textures)
classitems.name: getResources

params.name: resources
params.description: object where all the resources are stored

classitems.description: Event used to inform if one resource has changed its name
classitems.name: onResourceRenamed

params.name: resources
params.description: object where all the resources are stored

classitems.description: Loads all the textures inside this material, by sending the through the ResourcesManager
classitems.name: loadTextures

classitems.description: Register this material in a materials pool to be shared with other nodes
classitems.name: registerMaterial

params.name: name
params.description: name given to this material, it must be unique

classitems.description: assign a value to a property in a safe way
classitems.name: setProperty

classitems.description: gets all the properties and its types
classitems.name: getProperties

classitems.description: gets all the properties and its types
classitems.name: getProperties

classitems.description: Event used to inform if one resource has changed its name
classitems.name: onResourceRenamed

params.name: resources
params.description: object where all the resources are stored

classitems.description: gets all the properties and its types
classitems.name: getProperty

classitems.description: assign a value to a property in a safe way
classitems.name: setProperty

classitems.description: Assigns a texture to a channel
classitems.name: setTexture

classitems.description: Collects all the resources needed by this material (textures)
classitems.name: getResources

params.name: resources
params.description: object where all the resources are stored

classitems.description: Updates the normal matrix using the matrix
classitems.name: computeNormalMatrix

classitems.description: takes the flags on the node and update the render instance flags
classitems.name: applyNodeFlags

classitems.description: Enable flag in the flag bit field
classitems.name: enableFlag

classitems.description: Disable flag in the flag bit field
classitems.name: enableFlag

classitems.description: Tells if a flag is enabled
classitems.name: enableFlag

classitems.description: Computes the instance bounding box in world space from the one in local space
classitems.name: updateAABB

classitems.description: Used to update the RI info without having to go through the collectData process, it is faster but some changes may take a while
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Calls render taking into account primitive and range
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Checks if this object was visible by a camera during the last frame
classitems.name: wasVisibleByCamera

params.name: camera
params.description: [optional] if a camera is supplied it checks if it was visible by that camera, otherwise tells you if it was visible by any camera

return.description: true if it was visible by the camera (or any camera if no camera supplied), false otherwise

classitems.description:
Renders the current scene to the screen
Many steps are involved, from gathering info from the scene tree, generating shadowmaps, setup FBOs, render every camera
classitems.name: render

params.name: cameras
params.description: if no cameras are specified the cameras are taken from the scene

classitems.description: Calls renderFrame of every camera in the cameras list (triggering the appropiate events)
classitems.name: renderFrameCameras

classitems.description: renders the view from one camera to the current viewport (could be a texture)
classitems.name: renderFrame

classitems.description: Set camera as the current camera, sets the viewport according to camera info, updates matrices, and prepares LS.Draw
classitems.name: enableCamera

classitems.description: Calls the render method for every instance (it also takes into account events and frustrum culling
classitems.name: renderInstances

params.name: instances
params.description: array of RIs, if not specified the last visible_instances are rendered

classitems.description: To set gl state to a known and constant state in every render pass
classitems.name: resetGLState

classitems.description: Renders this render instance taking into account all the lights that affect it
classitems.name: renderColorPassInstance

params.name: lights
params.description: array containing al the lights affecting this RI

classitems.description: Renders this RenderInstance into the shadowmap
classitems.name: renderShadowPassInstance

classitems.description:
Special case of render instance that uses a 2D projection (used for GUIS)
Will be refactored for a better system
classitems.name: render2DInstance

classitems.description: Render instance into the picking buffer
classitems.name: renderPickingInstance

classitems.description:
Update the scene shader query according to the render pass
Do not reuse the query, they change between rendering passes (shadows, reflections, etc)
classitems.name: fillSceneShaderQuery

classitems.description: Switch flags according to the RenderInstance flags
classitems.name: enableInstanceFlags

classitems.description:
Collects and process the rendering instances, cameras and lights that are visible
Its a prepass shared among all rendering passes
classitems.name: processVisibleData

params.name: cameras
params.description: in case you dont want to use the scene cameras

classitems.description: Renders a frame into a texture (could be a cubemap, in which case does the six passes)
classitems.name: renderInstancesToRT

classitems.description: Renders the current scene to a cubemap centered in the given position
classitems.name: renderToCubemap

params.name: position
params.description: center of the camera where to render the cubemap

classitems.description: Renders the material preview to an image
classitems.name: renderMaterialPreview

classitems.description: Returns the last camera that falls into a given screen position
classitems.name: getCameraAtPosition

params.name: scene
params.description: if not specified last rendered scene will be used

classitems.description: Sets up everything (prepare meshes, shaders, and so)
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: A helper to create shaders when you only want to specify some basic shading
classitems.name: createSurfaceShader

params.name: surface_function
params.description: GLSL code like: "vec4 surface_function( vec3 pos, vec3 normal, vec2 coord ) { return vec4(1.0); } ";

classitems.description: clears the stack
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description: Sets the color used to paint primitives
classitems.name: setColor

classitems.description: Sets the alpha used to paint primitives
classitems.name: setAlpha

classitems.description: Sets the point size
classitems.name: setPointSize

classitems.description: Sets the camera to use during the rendering, this is already done by LS.Renderer
classitems.name: setCamera

classitems.description: Specifies the camera position (used to compute point size)
classitems.name: setCameraPosition

classitems.description: Specifies the camera view and projection matrices
classitems.name: setViewProjectionMatrix

classitems.description: Specifies the transformation matrix to apply to the mesh
classitems.name: setMatrix

classitems.description: Multiplies the current matrix by a given one
classitems.name: multMatrix

classitems.description: Render lines given a set of points
classitems.name: renderLines

params.name: strip
params.description: [optional] if the lines are a line strip (one consecutive line)

classitems.description: Render points given a set of positions (and colors)
classitems.name: renderPoints

classitems.description: Render round points given a set of positions (and colors)
classitems.name: renderRoundPoints

classitems.description: Render points with color, size, and texture binded in 0
classitems.name: renderPointsWithSize

classitems.description: Render points with color, size, and texture binded in 0
classitems.name: renderRectangle

params.name: in_z
params.description: [optional] if the plane is aligned with the z plane

classitems.description: Renders a circle
classitems.name: renderCircle

params.name: in_z
params.description: [optional] if the circle is aligned with the z plane

classitems.description: Render a filled circle
classitems.name: renderSolidCircle

params.name: in_z
params.description: [optional] if the circle is aligned with the z plane

classitems.description: Renders three circles to form a simple spherical shape
classitems.name: renderWireSphere

classitems.description: Renders a wire box (box made of lines, not filled)
classitems.name: renderWireBox

classitems.description: Renders a solid box
classitems.name: renderSolidBox

classitems.description: Renders a cone
classitems.name: renderCone

classitems.description: Renders a cylinder
classitems.name: renderCylinder

classitems.description: Renders an image
classitems.name: renderImage

params.name: image
params.description: from an URL, or a texture

classitems.description: Renders a given mesh applyting the stack transformations
classitems.name: renderMesh

params.name: indices
params.description: [optional="triangles"] the name of the buffer in the mesh with the indices

params.name: range_start
params.description: [optional] in case of rendering a range, the start primitive

params.name: range_length
params.description: [optional] in case of rendering a range, the number of primitives

classitems.description: Renders a text in the current matrix position
classitems.name: renderText

classitems.description: pushes the transform matrix into the stack to save the state
classitems.name: push

classitems.description: takes the matrix from the top position of the stack to restore the last saved state
classitems.name: push

classitems.description: clears the transform matrix setting it to an identity
classitems.name: identity

classitems.description: changes the scale of the transform matrix. The parameters could be a vec3, a single number (then the scale is uniform in all axis) or three numbers
classitems.name: scale

params.name: x
params.description: could be an array of 3, one value (if no other values are specified then it is an uniform scaling)

classitems.description: applies a translation to the transform matrix
classitems.name: translate

params.name: x
params.description: could be an array of 3 or the x transform

classitems.description: applies a translation to the transform matrix
classitems.name: rotate

params.name: x
params.description: could be the x component or the full axis

classitems.description:
moves an object to a given position and forces it to look to another direction
Warning: it doesnt changes the camera in any way, only the transform matrix
classitems.name: lookAt

classitems.description: projects a point from 3D space to 2D space (multiply by MVP)
classitems.name: project

return.description: the point in screen space (in normalized coordinates)

classitems.description: Allows to check if one Uint8Array contains a WBin file
classitems.name: WBin.isWBin

classitems.description:
Builds a WBin data stream from an object (every property of the object will be considered a lump with data)
It supports Numbers, Strings and TypedArrays or ArrayBuffer
classitems.name: WBin.create

params.name: origin
params.description: object containing all the lumps, the key will be used as lump name

params.name: origin_class_name
params.description: [Optional] allows to add a classname to the WBin, this is used to detect which class to instance when extracting it

classitems.description:
Extract the info from a Uint8Array containing WBin info and returns the object with all the lumps.
If the data contains info about the class to instantiate, the WBin instantiates the class and passes the data to it
classitems.name: WBin.load

params.name: skip_classname
params.description: avoid getting the instance of the class specified in classname, and get only the lumps

return.description: Could be an Object with all the lumps or an instance to the class specified in the WBin data

classitems.description: Extract the header info from an ArrayBuffer (it contains version, and lumps info)
classitems.name: WBin.getHeaderInfo

classitems.description: Create a clone of this node (the UID is removed to avoid collisions)
classitems.name: clone

classitems.description: To create a new property for this component adding some extra useful info to help the editor
classitems.name: createProperty

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the property as it will be accessed

params.name: value
params.description: the value to assign by default to this property

params.name: type
params.description: [optional] an string identifying the type of the variable, could be "number","string","Texture","vec3","mat4", or an object with all the info

params.name: setter
params.description: [optional] setter function, otherwise one will be created

params.name: getter
params.description: [optional] getter function, otherwise one will be created

classitems.description: Returns the locator string of this component
classitems.name: getLocator

return.description: the locator string of this component

classitems.description: Bind one object event to a method in this component
classitems.name: bind

params.name: object
params.description: the dispatcher of the event you want to react to

params.name: event
params.description: the name of the event to bind to

params.name: type
params.description: [optional] an string identifying the type of the variable, could be "number","string","Texture","vec3","mat4", or an object with all the info

params.name: setter
params.description: [optional] setter function, otherwise one will be created

params.name: getter
params.description: [optional] getter function, otherwise one will be created

classitems.description: Adds a component to this node.
classitems.name: configureComponents

params.name: info
params.description: object containing all the info from a previous serialization

classitems.description: Adds a component to this node.
classitems.name: serializeComponents

params.name: o
params.description: container where the components will be stored

classitems.description: returns an array with all the components
classitems.name: getComponents

classitems.description: Adds a component to this node. (maybe attach would been a better name)
classitems.name: addComponent

classitems.description: Removes a component from this node.
classitems.name: removeComponent

classitems.description: Removes all components from this node.
classitems.name: removeAllComponents

classitems.description: Returns if the class has an instance of this component
classitems.name: hasComponent

classitems.description: Returns the first component of this container that is of the same class
classitems.name: getComponent

params.name: component_class
params.description: the class to search a component from (not the name of the class)

classitems.description: Returns the component with the given uid
classitems.name: getComponentByUId

classitems.description: Returns the position in the components array of this component
classitems.name: getIndexOfComponent

params.name: position
params.description: in the array, -1 if not found

classitems.description: Returns the component at index position
classitems.name: getComponentByIndex

classitems.description: Changes the order of a component
classitems.name: setComponentIndex

classitems.description: executes the method with a given name in all the components
classitems.name: processActionInComponents

params.name: action_name
params.description: the name of the function to execute in all components (in string format)

params.name: params
params.description: array with every parameter that the function may need

classitems.description: Adds one child to this instance
classitems.name: addChild

params.name: index
params.description: [optional]  in which position you want to insert it, if not specified it goes to the last position

params.name: options
params.description: [optional] data to be passed when adding it, used for special cases when moving nodes around

classitems.description: Removes the node from its parent (and from the scene tree)
classitems.name: removeChild
classitems.param2: {*} param2 data passed to onChildRemoved as second parameter

return.description: returns true if it was found and removed

classitems.description: Remove node from parent
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description: Serialize the data from all the children
classitems.name: serializeChildren

return.description: array containing all serialized data from every children

classitems.description: Configure every children with the data
classitems.name: configureChildren

return.description: o array containing all serialized data

classitems.description: Returns parent node
classitems.name: getParent

classitems.description: get all nodes below this in the hierarchy (children and children of children)
classitems.name: getDescendants

classitems.description: Generates a UUID based in the user-agent, time, random and sequencial number. Used for Nodes and Components.
classitems.name: generateUId

classitems.description:
validates name string to ensure there is no forbidden characters
valid characters are letters, numbers, spaces, dash, underscore and dot
classitems.name: validateName

classitems.description: Contains all the registered components
classitems.name: Components

classitems.description: Register a component (or several) so it is listed when searching for new components to attach
classitems.name: registerComponent

classitems.description: Tells you if one class is a registered component class
classitems.name: isClassComponent

return.description: true if the component class is registered

classitems.description: Is a wrapper for callbacks that throws an LS "code_error" in case something goes wrong (needed to catch the error from the system)
classitems.name: safeCall

classitems.description: Is a wrapper for setTimeout that throws an LS "code_error" in case something goes wrong (needed to catch the error from the system)
classitems.name: setTimeout

classitems.description: Is a wrapper for setInterval that throws an LS "code_error" in case something goes wrong (needed to catch the error from the system)
classitems.name: setInterval

classitems.description: copy the properties (methods and properties) of origin class into target class
classitems.name: extendClass

classitems.description:
Clones an object (no matter where the object came from)
- It skip attributes starting with "_" or "jQuery" or functions
- to the rest it applies JSON.parse( JSON.stringify ( obj ) )
- use it carefully
classitems.name: cloneObject

classitems.description: Clears all the uids inside this object and children (it also works with serialized object)
classitems.name: clearUIds

params.name: root
params.description: could be a node or an object from a node serialization

classitems.description: Returns an object class name (uses the constructor toString)
classitems.name: getObjectClassName

params.name: the
params.description: object to see the class name

return.description: returns the string with the name

classitems.description: Returns an string with the class name
classitems.name: getClassName

return.description: returns the string with the name

classitems.description: Returns the public properties of one object and the type
classitems.name: getObjectProperties

return.description: returns object with attribute name and its type

classitems.description: Contains all the registered material classes
classitems.name: MaterialClasses

classitems.description: Register a Material class so it is listed when searching for new materials to attach
classitems.name: registerMaterialClass

classitems.description: Returns the DOM element responsible for the GUI of the app. This is helpful because this GUI will be automatically remove if the app finishes.
classitems.name: getGUIElement

classitems.description: Returns an script context using the script name (not the node name), usefull to pass data between scripts.
classitems.name: getScript

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the script according to the Script component.

classitems.description: Returns an script context using the script name (not the node name), usefull to pass data between scripts.
classitems.name: getScript

params.name: name
params.description: the name of the script according to the Script component.

classitems.description:
Assigns a value to a property of one node in the scene, just by using a string identifier
Example:  LSQ.set("mynode|a_child/MeshRenderer/enabled",false);
classitems.name: set

params.name: locator
params.description: the locator string identifying the property

classitems.description:
Retrieves the value of a property of one node in the scene, just by using a string identifier
Example: var value = LSQ.get("mynode|a_child/MeshRenderer/enabled");
classitems.name: get

params.name: locator
params.description: the locator string identifying the property

classitems.description:
Shortens a locator that uses unique identifiers to a simpler one, but be careful, because it uses names instead of UIDs it could point to the wrong property
Example: "@NODE--a40661-1e8a33-1f05e42-56/@COMP--a40661-1e8a34-1209e28-57/size" -> "node|child/Collider/size"
classitems.name: shortify

return.description: the locator using names instead of UIDs

classitems.description:
Tells the system info about this file format
Info should contain fields like type:"image", resource: "Mesh|Texture", format: "text|binary", parse: function, native: true|false
classitems.name: addFormat

classitems.description: Parse some data and returns the resulting resource
classitems.name: parse

params.name: data
params.description: could be a string, binary, arraybuffer, xml...

params.name: options
params.description: how the file should be parsed

return.description: the final resource, could be a Texture, a Mesh, or an object

classitems.description: A front-end for XMLHttpRequest so it is simpler and more cross-platform
classitems.name: request

params.name: request
params.description:
object with the fields for the request: 
			dataType: result type {text,xml,json,binary,arraybuffer,image}, data: object with form fields, callbacks supported: {success, error, progress}

classitems.description: retrieve a file from url (you can bind LEvents to done and fail)
classitems.name: requestFile

classitems.description: retrieve a JSON file from url (you can bind LEvents to done and fail)
classitems.name: requestJSON

classitems.description: retrieve a text file from url (you can bind LEvents to done and fail)
classitems.name: requestText

classitems.description: Request script and inserts it in the DOM
classitems.name: requireScript

params.name: url
params.description: could be an array with urls to load in order

params.name: on_progress
params.description: (if several files are required, on_progress is called after every file is added to the DOM)

classitems.description: Computes the instance bounding box in world space from the one in local space
classitems.name: updateAABB

classitems.description: Cast a ray that traverses the scene checking for collisions with Colliders
classitems.name: raycast

params.name: options
params.description: ( max_dist maxium distance, layers which layers to check, scene, first_collision )

return.description: Array of Collision objects containing all the nodes that collided with the ray or null in the form [SceneNode, Collider, collision point, distance]

classitems.description: Test if a sphere collides with any of the colliders in the scene
classitems.name: testSphere

return.description: the first PhysicsObject that collided with, otherwise null

classitems.description: Renders the pixel and retrieves the color to detect which object it was, slow but accurate
classitems.name: getNodeAtCanvasPosition

classitems.description: Returns the instance under a screen position
classitems.name: getInstanceAtCanvasPosition

return.description: the info supplied by the picker (usually a SceneNode)

classitems.description:
Cast a ray that traverses the scene checking for collisions with RenderInstances
Similar to Physics.raycast but using only the bounding boxes of the visible meshes
classitems.name: raycast

params.name: options
params.description: ( max_distance: maxium ray distance, layers, scene, max_distance, first_collision : returns the first collision (which could be not the closest one) )

return.description: array containing all the RenderInstances that collided with the ray in the form [SceneNode, RenderInstance, collision point, distance]

classitems.description:
Returns a color you should use to paint this node during picking rendering
you tell what info you want to retrieve associated with this object if it is clicked
classitems.name: getNextPickingColor

return.description: array containing all the RenderInstances that collided with the ray

classitems.description: Loads an scene and triggers start
classitems.name: loadScene

params.name: url
params.description: url to the JSON file containing all the scene info

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback trigged when the scene and the resources are loaded

classitems.description: loads Scene from object or JSON
classitems.name: setScene

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback trigged when the scene and the resources are loaded

classitems.description: Returns a string to append to any url that should use the browser cache (when updating server info)
classitems.name: getNoCache

params.name: force
params.description: force to return a nocache string ignoring the default configuration

return.description: a string to attach to a url so the file wont be cached

classitems.description: Resets all the resources cached, so it frees the memory
classitems.name: reset

classitems.description:
Resources need to be parsed once the data has been received, some formats could be parsed using native functions (like images) others 
require to pass the data through a function.
Registering a resource preprocessor the data will be converted once it is in memory
classitems.name: registerResourcePreProcessor

params.name: fileformats
params.description: the extension of the formats that this function will parse

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to call once the data must be processed, if the process is async it must return true

classitems.description:
Some resources require to be processed right after being parsed to ensure they are ready (meshes need to have the AABB computed...)
This job could be done inside the parser but it is better to do it separatedly.
classitems.name: registerResourcePostProcessor

params.name: resource_type
params.description: the name of the class of the resource

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to call once the data has been processed

classitems.description: Returns the filename extension from an url
classitems.name: getExtension

classitems.description: Returns the filename from a full path
classitems.name: getFilename

classitems.description: Returns the folder from a fullpath
classitems.name: getFolder

classitems.description: Returns the filename without the extension
classitems.name: getBasename

classitems.description: Cleans resource name (removing double slashes)
classitems.name: cleanFullpath

classitems.description: Loads all the resources in the Object (it uses an object to store not only the filename but also the type)
classitems.name: loadResources

params.name: resources
params.description: contains all the resources, associated with its type

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resources

classitems.description:
Set the base path where all the resources will be fetched (unless they have absolute URL)
By default it will use the website home address
classitems.name: setPath

classitems.description:
Set a proxy url where all non-local resources will be requested, allows to fetch assets to other servers.
request will be in this form: proxy_url + "/" + url_with_protocol: ->   http://myproxy.com/google.com/images/...
classitems.name: setProxy

classitems.description: transform a url to a full url taking into account proxy, virtual file systems and local_repository
classitems.name: getFullURL

classitems.description:
Allows to associate a resource path like "vfs:myfile.png" to an url according to the value before the ":".
This way we can have alias for different folders where the assets are stored.
P.e:   "e","http://domain.com"  -> will transform "e:myfile.png" in "http://domain.com/myfile.png"
classitems.name: registerFileSystem

params.name: name
params.description: the filesystem name (the string before the colons in the path)

classitems.description: Returns the resource if it has been loaded, if you want to force to load it, use load
classitems.name: getResource

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

classitems.description: Marks the resource as modified, used in editor to know when a resource data should be updated
classitems.name: resourceModified

classitems.description: Unmarks the resource as modified
classitems.name: resourceSaved

classitems.description:
Loads a generic resource, the type will be infered from the extension, if it is json or wbin it will be processed
Do not use to load regular files (txts, csv, etc), instead use the LS.Network methods
classitems.name: load

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resource when processing it

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback when the resource is loaded and cached, params: callback( url, resource, options )

classitems.description:
Process resource get some form of data and transforms it to a resource (and Object ready to be used by the engine).
In most cases the process involves parsing and uploading to the GPU
It is called for every single resource that comes from an external source (URL) right after being loaded
classitems.name: processResource

params.name: url
params.description: where the resource is located (if its a relative url it depends on the path attribute)

params.name: data
params.description: the data of the resource (could be string, arraybuffer, image... )

params.name: options
params.description: options to apply to the loaded resource

classitems.description: Stores the resource inside the manager containers. This way it will be retrieveble by anybody who needs it.
classitems.name: registerResource

classitems.description: removes the resources from all the containers
classitems.name: unregisterResource

return.description: true is removed, false if not found

classitems.description:
Returns an object with a representation of the resource internal data
The order to obtain that object is:
1. test for _original_file (File or Blob)
2. test for _original_data (ArrayBuffer)
3. toBinary() (ArrayBuffer)
4. toBlob() (Blob)
5. toBase64() (String)
6. serialize() (Object in JSON format)
7. data property 
8. JSON.stringify(...)
classitems.name: computeResourceInternalData

return.description: it has two fields: data and encoding

classitems.description: Used to load files and get them as File (or Blob)
classitems.name: getURLasFile

classitems.description: Changes the name of a resource and sends an event to all components to change it accordingly
classitems.name: renameResource

params.name: skip_event
params.description: ignore sending an event to all components to rename the resource

classitems.description: Tells if it is loading resources
classitems.name: isLoading

classitems.description: forces to try to reload again resources not found
classitems.name: isLoading

classitems.description: returns a mesh resource if it is loaded
classitems.name: getMesh

classitems.description: returns a texture resource if it is loaded
classitems.name: getTexture

params.name: filename
params.description: could be a texture itself in which case returns the same texture

classitems.description: Binds a callback for when a resource is loaded (in case you need to do something special)
classitems.name: onceLoaded

params.name: fullpath
params.description: of the resource you want to get the notification once is loaded

params.name: callback
params.description: the function to call, it will be called as callback( fullpath, resource )

classitems.description:
This initializes the content of the scene.
Call it to clear the scene content
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
Clears the scene using the init function
and trigger a "clear" LEvent
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description: Fired when the whole scene is cleared
classitems.name: clear

classitems.description:
Configure the Scene using an object (the object can be obtained from the function serialize)
Inserts the nodes, configure them, and change the parameters
Destroys previously existing info
classitems.name: configure

params.name: scene_info
params.description: the object containing all the info about the nodes and config of the scene

classitems.description: Fired after the scene has been configured
classitems.name: configure

params.name: scene_info
params.description: contains all the info to do the configuration

classitems.description:
Creates and object containing all the info about the scene and nodes.
The oposite of configure.
It calls the serialize method in every node
classitems.name: serialize

return.description: return a JS Object with all the scene info

classitems.description: Fired after the scene has been serialized to an object
classitems.name: serialize

classitems.description: loads a scene from a JSON description
classitems.name: load

params.name: url
params.description: where the JSON object containing the scene is stored

params.name: on_complete
params.description: the callback to call when the loading is complete

params.name: on_error
params.description: the callback to call if there is a  loading error

classitems.description: Fired before loading scene
classitems.name: beforeLoad

classitems.description: Fired when the scene has been loaded but before the resources
classitems.name: load

classitems.description: Fired after all resources have been loaded
classitems.name: loadCompleted

classitems.description: Fired when a new node is added to this scene
classitems.name: nodeAdded

classitems.description: Fired after a node has been removed
classitems.name: nodeRemoved

classitems.description: retrieves a Node based on the name, path ( name|childname|etc ) or uid
classitems.name: getNode

return.description: the node or null if it didnt find it

classitems.description:
retrieves a Node that matches that name. It is fast because they are stored in an object.
If more than one object has the same name, the first one added to the tree is returned
classitems.name: getNodeByName

return.description: the node or null if it didnt find it

classitems.description: retrieves a Node based on a given uid. It is fast because they are stored in an object
classitems.name: getNodeByUId

return.description: the node or null if it didnt find it

classitems.description: retrieves a Node by its index
classitems.name: getNodeByIndex

return.description: returns the node at the 'index' position in the nodes array

classitems.description: retrieves a node array filtered by the filter function
classitems.name: filterNodes

params.name: filter
params.description: a callback function that receives every node and must return true or false

return.description: array containing the nodes that passes the filter

classitems.description: searches the component with this uid, it iterates through all the nodes and components (slow)
classitems.name: findComponentByUId

classitems.description: searches the material with this uid, it iterates through all the nodes (slow)
classitems.name: findMaterialByUId

classitems.description:
Returns information of a node component property based on the locator of that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: getPropertyInfo

return.description: object with node, component, name, and value

classitems.description:
Returns information of a node component property based on the locator of that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: getPropertyInfoFromPath

return.description: object with node, component, name, and value

classitems.description:
Assigns a value to the property of a component in a node based on the locator of that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: setPropertyValue

params.name: target
params.description: [Optional] used to avoid searching for the component every time

return.description: the target where the action was performed

classitems.description:
Assigns a value to the property of a component in a node based on the locator that property
Locators are in the form of "{NODE_UID}/{COMPONENT_UID}/{property_name}"
classitems.name: setPropertyValueFromPath

return.description: the target where the action was performed

classitems.description:
loads all the resources of all the nodes in this scene
it sends a signal to every node to get all the resources info
and load them in bulk using the ResourceManager
classitems.name: loadResources

classitems.description: start the scene (triggers an "start" event)
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: Fired when the scene is starting to play
classitems.name: start

classitems.description: stop the scene (triggers an "finish" event)
classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: Fired when the scene stops playing
classitems.name: finish

classitems.description: renders the scene using the assigned renderer
classitems.name: render

classitems.description:
This methods crawls the whole tree and collects all the useful info (cameras, lights, render instances, colliders, etc)
Mostly rendering stuff but also some collision info.
classitems.name: collectData

classitems.description: Fired before doing an update
classitems.name: beforeUpdate

classitems.description: Fired while updating
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Fired after updating the scene
classitems.name: afterUpdate

classitems.description: triggers an event to all nodes in the scene
classitems.name: triggerInNodes

params.name: data
params.description: data to send associated to the event

classitems.description: changes the node name
classitems.name: setName

return.description: returns true if the name changed

classitems.description: Node changed name
classitems.name: name_changed

classitems.description: Assigns this node to one layer
classitems.name: setLayer

classitems.description: remember clones this node and returns the new copy (you need to add it to the scene to see it)
classitems.name: clone

return.description: returns a cloned version of this node

classitems.description: Configure this node from an object containing the info
classitems.name: configure

params.name: info
params.description: the object with all the info (comes from the serialize method)

classitems.description:
Serializes this node by creating an object with all the info
it contains info about the components too
classitems.name: serialize

return.description: returns the object with the info

classitems.description: Initializes the shader manager
classitems.name: init

params.name: url
params.description: a url to a shaders.xml can be specified to load the shaders

classitems.description: Reloads the XML file with the shaders, useful when editing the file
classitems.name: reloadShaders

params.name: on_complete
params.description: call when the shaders have been reloaded

classitems.description: Resolves a shader query, returns the shader
classitems.name: resolve

return.description: the shader, if not found the default shader is returned

classitems.description: Clears all the compiled shaders
classitems.name: clearCache

classitems.description: Returns a compiled shader with this id and this macros
classitems.name: get

return.description: the shader, if not found the default shader is returned

classitems.description: Returns the info of a global shader
classitems.name: getGlobalShaderInfo

classitems.description: Compiles a shader, the vertex and fragment shader are cached indepently to speed up compilations but a unique name must be provided
classitems.name: compileShader

params.name: vs_code
params.description: the final source code for the vertex shader

params.name: fs_code
params.description: the final source code for the fragment shader

params.name: name
params.description: an unique name that should be associated with this shader

classitems.description: Stores a compiled shader program, so it can be reused
classitems.name: registerCompiledShader

classitems.description: Loads shaders code from an XML file
classitems.name: loadFromXML

params.name: reset_old
params.description: to reset all the existing shaders once loaded

params.name: on_complete
params.description: callback once the file has been loaded and processed

classitems.description: extracts all the shaders from the XML doc
classitems.name: processShadersXML

classitems.description: extracts all the shaders from the XML doc
classitems.name: registerGlobalShader

classitems.description: Register a code snippet ready to be used by the #import clause in the shader
classitems.name: registerSnippet

classitems.description: Returns the code of a snipper
classitems.name: getSnippet

classitems.description: Create some default shaders useful for generic situations (flat, texture and screenspace quad)
classitems.name: createDefaultShaders

classitems.description: Resamples a full curve in values (useful to upload to GPU array)
classitems.name: resampleCurve
